answers.answer: Hello.Even though Diabetes is a common cause of neuropathy, it is not the only one. There could be other reasons. Do you have any spine problems ? And there could be some vitamin deficiencies, especially Vitamin B12.Do you have any weakness in the muscles ?Regards

question: My doctor is surprised that I have periperal neuropathy when I am not a diabetic.  I experience alternate sensations of heat and cold in my feet and legs to my calves, especially at night.  Sometimes the heat sensation is only in my knees, to the point of waking me up.  If I get up and walk around for a while it goes away, but it is quite intolerable while it lasts.  What do I do?  My doctor has advised Lyrica, but I am reluctant.  I eat a careful low-fat diet, using little sugar, only Himmelayan Crystal salt, coconut and olive oil, some mostly-spelt bread, lots of green and yellow veggies, fruit, and I take a pure glutathione-building protein powder that gets the best results, but not full relief.  My discomfort greatly affects my walking at times.
title: peripheral neuropathy
